body:
## Bug Report ### What version of TiKV are you using? ``` TiKV Release Version: 4.1.0-alpha Git Commit Hash: 50ceedd57dcc01ac1f8670a0672eabb79329ee0b Git Commit Branch: HEAD UTC Build Time: 2020-03-23 02:12:58 Rust Version: rustc 1.42.0-nightly (0de96d37f 2019-12-19) Enable Features: jemalloc portable sse protobuf-codec Profile: dist_release ``` ### What operating system and CPU are you using? CentOS 7. `Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2630 v4 @ 2.20GHz` × 40 ### Steps to reproduce 1. Prepare an database of size ≥ 5 GiB (sysbench with 4 tables and 58 million rows each). ```sh sysbench /usr/share/sysbench/tests/include/oltp_legacy/oltp.lua --mysql-host=172.16.4.95 --mysql-port=4000 --mysql-user=root --oltp-test-mode=complex --oltp-tables-count=10 --oltp-table-size=150000000 --threads=10 --time=120 --report-interval=10 prepare ``` 2. Perform a BR backup to an AWS S3 storage. ### What did you expect? Succeed ### What did happened?
Hyper crashed with this fatal log: ``` [2020/03/24 20:00:34.405 +08:00] [FATAL] [lib.rs:480] ["dispatch dropped without returning error"] [backtrace="stack backtrace: 0: tikv_util::set_panic_hook::{{closure}} at components/tikv_util/src/lib.rs:479 1: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook at src/libstd/panicking.rs:475 2: std::panicking::begin_panic at /rustc/0de96d37fbcc54978458c18f5067cd9817669bc8/src/libstd/panicking.rs:404 3: hyper::client::conn::SendRequest::send_request_retryable::{{closure}} at /home/jenkins/agent/workspace/tikv_ghpr_build_release/tikv/<::std::macros::panic macros>:3 as core::future::future::Future>::poll::{{closure}} at /rust/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/futures-util-0.3.4/src/future/future/then.rs:44 futures_util::future::future::chain::Chain::poll at core::future::future::Future>::poll at /rust/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/futures-util-0.3.4/src/future/try_future/map_err.rs:43 ::try_poll at title: Backup to S3 panics for a table ~30 GiB
